definitions.definition: be aware of (a person or object) through touching or being touched.
examples: she felt someone touch her shoulder
synonyms: be conscious of "she felt a breeze on her back"

definitions.definition: be aware of (something happening) through physical sensation.
examples: she felt the ground give way beneath her
he touched her head and felt her hair
synonyms: assess "feel the temperature of the water"

definitions.definition: give a sensation of a particular physical quality when touched.
synonyms: strike one as "the air feels damp"

examples: they want to feel out the situation

definitions.definition: fondle someone for one's own sexual stimulation.

examples: I felt a sense of excitement
synonyms: suffer "you will not feel any pain"

definitions.definition: consider oneself to be in a particular state or exhibiting particular qualities.
examples: he doesn't feel obliged to visit every weekend

definitions.definition: have the strength and energy to do or deal with.
examples: after the accident she didn't feel up to driving
Ruth was not quite feeling herself
he didn't feel the loss of his mother so keenly

synonyms: condole with "tell your mother we certainly feel for her"

definitions.definition: have a belief or impression, especially without an identifiable reason.
examples: she felt that the woman positively disliked her
synonyms: intuit "I feel that he is only biding his time"

examples: I felt I could make a useful contribution
synonyms: figure "he feels that he should go to the meeting"
